senses.ex: The quiet library is conducive to studying.

Tips.title: Context Matters
Tips.description: The word 'conducive' often appears with 'to' following a condition that benefits from it.
Tips.example: Regular exercise is conducive to good health.

Tips.title: Positive Conditions
Tips.description: Use 'conducive' when describing situations or environments that support a positive outcome.
Tips.example: A peaceful corner of the park is conducive to relaxing.

Tips.title: Subject Variety
Tips.description: 'Conducive' can be used with a wide variety of subjects, from weather to policies.
Tips.example: The company's policy is conducive to employee retention.

Advantageous.wordDefinition:
Advantageous means something is helpful or useful, it gives an advantage in a situation. For example, if a person has experience in a field, it could be advantageous when getting a job in that field.

Advantageous refers to something that is helpful or gives an advantage, while conducive refers to creating an environment or conditions that are helpful or supportive.

Beneficial.wordDefinition:
Both beneficial and conducive indicate positive effects or outcomes, but there is a slight difference.

Beneficial means helpful or advantageous in achieving a particular goal or purpose. For example, exercising regularly is beneficial for your health.

Beneficial speaks to the actual positive outcomes, while conducive speaks to the conditions that make those outcomes possible.

Constructive.wordDefinition:
Constructive means something that is helpful and positive. For example, constructive criticism is feedback that helps you improve.

Conducive is more about creating the right conditions for something to happen, while constructive is more about helping improve something that already exists.

Favourable.wordDefinition:
Favourable means that something is advantageous or beneficial. For example, if the weather is favourable, it means that it is good for outdoor activities.

Conducive describes something that creates the best conditions for a specific objective, whereas favourable describes something that is positive or beneficial in a general sense.

Productive.wordDefinition:
Productive means being able to produce or achieve something. For example, when someone is productive at work, it means they are getting things done efficiently and effectively.

Both words are applicable in different situations. Conducive is more about creating the right conditions for something to happen, while productive is about achieving a result.

However, it's possible to have a workspace that is conducive but not productive if you are not actually getting anything done.

Propitious.wordDefinition:
Conducive means something that helps or contributes towards achieving something, while propitious means something that is favorable or good for a particular situation or outcome.

For example, a quiet study environment is conducive to learning because it helps students concentrate, while sunny weather is propitious for outdoor activities like picnics or sports.

Conducive is more about contributing towards a goal or desired outcome, while propitious is more about favorable circumstances or conditions.

Support.wordDefinition:
Support means to help or assist someone or something in achieving a goal or objective. For example, a strong team can support each other to achieve a common goal.

Conducive describes a situation or condition that is ideal or helpful for something, while support describes actions taken by someone to help or assist someone or something.

quotes.Text: I am not saying that government has nothing to offer. Government has an important role in fostering an environment conducive to business creation while also protecting its citizens. These are not mutually exclusive.
quotes.Title: American Businesswoman
quotes.Name: Sher Valenzuela

quotes.Text: I champion sensibly designed racial affirmative action, not because I have benefited from it personally - though I have. I support it because, on balance, it is conducive to the public good.
quotes.Title: American Educator
quotes.Name: Randall Kennedy

quotes.Text: I have kids and I want to have a long life and there are certain things that are conducive to that and certain things that aren't. I've opted for the road of happiness and long life.
quotes.Title: American Actor
quotes.Name: Ethan Suplee

quotes.Text: We should be working for protecting unity and integrity of the country... We should all strive to maintain a conducive atmosphere among the different communities.

quotes.Name: Rajnath Singh

quotes.Text: Fullness of knowledge always means some understanding of the depths of our ignorance; and that is always conducive to humility and reverence.

quotes.Name: Robert Andrews Millikan

quotes.Text: Coming to terms with the fear of death is conducive to healing, positive personality transformation, and consciousness evolution.

quotes.Name: Stanislav Grof

quotes.Text: There are a lot of things about fame that are not conducive to being curious. It's been important for me to cloister myself off.

quotes.Text: The thing that is most conducive of that better life for all is love, acceptance, understanding and being yourself.

quotes.Text: Nothing is more conducive to peace of mind than not having any opinion at all.

quotes.Name: Georg C. Lichtenberg

quotes.Text: Life creates conditions conducive to life.
